meanings.definition: A person who believes that the only thing that can be known to exist is their own mind.
meanings.sent1: The solipsist thought that only their mind was real.
meanings.sent2: As a solipsist, she believed that her mind was the only certainty.
meanings.sent3: The solipsist chuckled at the idea of everyone else being just figments of their imagination.
meanings.sent4: In the solipsist's world, reality was confined to the boundaries of their own thoughts.
meanings.sent5: The solipsist's belief in their mind's supremacy was unwavering.

meanings.definition: One who holds the belief that the self is the only reality.
meanings.sent1: Being a solipsist, he saw himself as the center of the universe.
meanings.sent2: The solipsist's philosophy revolved around the idea of self as the ultimate reality.
meanings.sent3: The solipsist found humor in the notion that only they truly existed.
meanings.sent4: To the solipsist, the world was merely a reflection of their own being.
meanings.sent5: The solipsist's conviction in self-reality was unshakable.
